assignUser commented on PR #13266:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13266#issuecomment-1142038537

   @nealrichardson this is improved overall according to your suggestions and
   - it will only upload if all tests jobs succeed + check for files in `r_nightly.yml`
   - added ubuntu 22.04 (deactivated for now as the test jobs would fail due to `distro-map.csv`, turn back on after [this](https://github.com/ursa-labs/arrow-r-nightly/pull/23) is merged)
   
   Once we have some files uploaded to nightlies.a.o I would like to add pruning and multi-version PACKAGES in a follow up.

nealrichardson commented on code in PR #13266:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13266#discussion_r885876155


##########
dev/tasks/r/github.packages.yml:
##########
@@ -279,8 +286,8 @@ jobs:
           {{ macros.github_test_r_src_pkg()|indent(8) }}
 
   upload-binaries:
-    needs: r-packages
-    if: true && !cancelled()
+    # Only upload binaries if all tests pass.

Review Comment:
   There's a whole lot of code that munges file names and paths here and then especially on the other side in r_nightly.yml to essentially rebuild the repo directory structure you already have here. What if you just zipped up the whole repo directory and uploaded it as a single artifact? Then in r_nightly.yml you just unzip it and you already have the right directory structure. 



##########
dev/tasks/r/github.packages.yml:
##########
@@ -14,13 +14,16 @@
 # KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
 # specific language governing permissions and limitations
 # under the License.
+#
+# This workflow was adapted from https://github.com/ursa-labs/arrow-r-nightly

Review Comment:
   There needs to be an entry added to the bottom of https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/LICENSE.txt

assignUser commented on code in PR #13266:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13266#discussion_r886009514


##########
dev/tasks/r/github.packages.yml:
##########
@@ -279,8 +286,8 @@ jobs:
           {{ macros.github_test_r_src_pkg()|indent(8) }}
 
   upload-binaries:
-    needs: r-packages
-    if: true && !cancelled()
+    # Only upload binaries if all tests pass.

Review Comment:
   This would be a nice solution if we had the actual repo structure in this job, which we don't :(. Downloading the artifacts just creates subfolders with the artifact name which are then used to re-name the files to distinguish them. 
   
   I could move the repo-creation code from r_nightly into this workflow but we can't do without it, sorry!

assignUser commented on code in PR #13266:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13266#discussion_r886009514


##########
dev/tasks/r/github.packages.yml:
##########
@@ -279,8 +286,8 @@ jobs:
           {{ macros.github_test_r_src_pkg()|indent(8) }}
 
   upload-binaries:
-    needs: r-packages
-    if: true && !cancelled()
+    # Only upload binaries if all tests pass.

Review Comment:
   This would be a nice solution if we had the actual repo structure in this job, which we don't :(. Downloading the artifacts just creates subfolders (`artifacts/r-pkg-src/arrow_8.0.0.tar.gz ...`)with the artifact name which are then used to re-name the files to distinguish them. 
   
   I could move the repo-creation code from r_nightly into this workflow but we can't do without it, sorry!

nealrichardson commented on code in PR #13266:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13266#discussion_r886088105


##########
dev/tasks/r/github.packages.yml:
##########
@@ -279,8 +286,8 @@ jobs:
           {{ macros.github_test_r_src_pkg()|indent(8) }}
 
   upload-binaries:
-    needs: r-packages
-    if: true && !cancelled()
+    # Only upload binaries if all tests pass.

Review Comment:
   But you have `macros.github_setup_local_r_repo`

assignUser commented on code in PR #13266:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13266#discussion_r886127186


##########
dev/tasks/r/github.packages.yml:
##########
@@ -279,8 +286,8 @@ jobs:
           {{ macros.github_test_r_src_pkg()|indent(8) }}
 
   upload-binaries:
-    needs: r-packages
-    if: true && !cancelled()
+    # Only upload binaries if all tests pass.

Review Comment:
   Yes, but that only does src + libarrow and is missing all the windows/mac multiple version logic that the R code in `r_nightly` has. Extending it to do this would be much messier with jinja looped yaml mixed with R...

fields.description:
Only upload if all tests succeed, improve overall polish, and improve documentation.

Add ubuntu 22.04 binary (see ARROW-16678).
